''Bera(n)'' ([[Old English|OE]]) | titles= | position= | location=''Presumably'' [[wikipedia:Anglia (peninsula)|Anglia]] | affiliation= | language=[[Old English]] | birth= | birthlocation= | rule= | death=[[wikipedia:5th century|5th century AD]] | deathlocation= | age= | notablefor= | house= | parentage=[[Heden]] | siblings=[[Eoh]] | spouse= | children= | gender=Male | height= | hair= | eyes= | clothing= | weapons= | steed= }} '''Beorn''' was a son of a [[Men|Man]] named [[Heden]], according to the early version of the [[legendarium]] in ''[[The Book of Lost Tales]]''. Beorn was noted for the murder of his brother [[Eoh]], the father of [[Eriol]],{{LT1|In}}, pp. 23-4 who died either "in the siege" of his town or "in a great battle". Many years later, Beorn himself was killed by [[Hengest]] and [[Horsa]], Eoh's grandsons, in an act of vengeance.{{LT2|VI}}, outline '''10''', p. 290 == Etymology == The name ''Beorn'' is in [[Old English]]. It means "warrior", but its original meaning was "bear". == Other names == Another variation of his name was ([[Gothic]]) '''''Bernus''''', which was probably intended as a form of ''baírnus'', a Gothic equivalent of the name, with [[Tolkien]] changing the spelling from ''aí'' to ''e''. In [[Qenya]] he was called '''''Veran''''' or '''''Verain''''', with the name '''''Beren''''' being its [[Gnomish]] cognate.{{PE|15}}, "[[Names and Required Alterations]]", Appendix, ''Text IX'', pp. 16-7The reading of ''Beren'' is uncertain. An alternative reading might be '''''Berin''''' instead. The name ''Veran'' itself was changed from ''Verus'', an earlier name.
